lines.text: TITUS LARTIUS, having set a guard upon  Corioli, going with drum and trumpet toward  COMINIUS and CAIUS MARCIUS, enters with Lieutenant, other Soldiers, and a Scout

lines.speaker: lartius
lines.text: So, let the ports be guarded: keep your duties, As I have set them down. If I do send, dispatch Those centuries to our aid: the rest will serve For a short holding: if we lose the field, We cannot keep the town.

lines.speaker: lartius
lines.text: Hence, and shut your gates upon's. Our guider, come; to the Roman camp conduct us.
